html.question: Which HTML tag defines the main content of a page?
html.hint: This tag is semantic and represents the primary content of the document.

html.question: Which tag is not semantic in HTML5?
html.hint: Semantic tags provide meaning to content, unlike generic containers.

html.question: What does the <meta> tag provide?
html.hint: This tag provides information like character set or SEO details.

html.question: Which tag is used for internal CSS?
html.hint: This tag holds CSS rules within the HTML document.

html.question: Which attribute opens a link in a new tab?
html.hint: This attribute uses the 'target' property with a specific value for new tabs.

html.question: Which tag creates a line break?
html.hint: This self-closing tag adds a single line break in text.

html.question: What is the correct HTML tag for a paragraph?
html.hint: This tag is a single letter followed by angle brackets.

html.question: Which tag defines a table row?
html.hint: This tag groups cells in a horizontal line within a table.

html.question: What does the <title> tag do?
html.hint: This tag sets the text shown in the browser's title bar.

html.question: Which tag is used for an unordered list?
html.hint: This tag creates a list with bullet points.

html.question: What is the root element of an HTML page?
html.hint: This tag wraps all other tags in an HTML document.

html.question: Which tag embeds an image?
html.hint: This self-closing tag uses a 'src' attribute for images.

html.question: What does the <a> tag create?
html.hint: This tag creates a clickable link with an 'href' attribute.

html.question: Which attribute specifies an image source?
html.hint: This attribute points to the file path of an image.

html.question: Which tag defines a form?
html.hint: This tag wraps input fields for user data submission.

html.question: Which attribute provides alternate text for images?
html.hint: This attribute improves accessibility for screen readers.

html.question: What is the default method for a form?
html.hint: This HTTP method appends data to the URL.

html.question: Which tag creates a numbered list?
html.hint: This tag creates a list with numbers or letters.

html.question: Which attribute links to an external CSS file?
html.hint: This attribute is used in a <link> tag for external styles.

html.question: What does the <header> tag represent?
html.hint: This semantic tag often contains logos or navigation.

html.question: Which tag defines a table header cell?
html.hint: This tag is like <td> but for bolded header cells.

html.question: What does the <aside> tag represent?
html.hint: This tag holds content tangentially related to the main content.

html.question: Which attribute specifies a formâ€™s submission URL?
html.hint: This attribute defines where form data is sent.

html.question: Which tag is used for inline CSS?
html.hint: This tag can be used in the head or inline with a 'style' attribute.

html.question: What does the <nav> tag define?
html.hint: This semantic tag groups menu or navigation links.

html.question: Which attribute disables an input field?
html.hint: This attribute prevents user interaction with a form field.

html.question: What is the purpose of the <figure> tag?
html.hint: This tag often pairs with <figcaption> for images or diagrams.

html.question: Which attribute specifies a character encoding?
html.hint: This attribute is used in a <meta> tag for encoding like UTF-8.

html.question: What does the <time> tag represent?
html.hint: This semantic tag formats dates or times for accessibility.

html.question: Which tag embeds a video?
html.hint: This tag supports attributes like 'src' and 'controls' for videos.

html.question: Which attribute makes an input required?
html.hint: This attribute ensures a form field must be filled before submission.

html.question: What does the <footer> tag typically contain?
html.hint: This semantic tag often includes copyright or contact details.

html.question: Which tag creates a dropdown menu?
html.hint: This tag works with <option> tags to create a dropdown.

html.question: Which attribute sets the maximum input length?
html.hint: This attribute limits the number of characters in a text input.

html.question: What does the <section> tag define?
html.hint: This tag organizes content into distinct, related sections.

html.question: Which tag embeds audio?
html.hint: This tag supports attributes like 'src' for sound files.

html.question: Which tag defines a list item?
html.hint: This tag is used inside <ul> or <ol> for individual items.

html.question: What does the <hr> tag create?
html.hint: This self-closing tag adds a thematic break or line.

html.question: Which tag is used for bold text?
html.hint: These tags make text bold, but one is semantic.

html.question: Which tag creates a hyperlink?
html.hint: This tag uses 'href' to link to another page or resource.

html.question: What does the <head> tag contain?
html.hint: This tag holds information like <title> and <meta> tags.

html.question: Which tag defines a table?
html.hint: This tag wraps rows and cells to create a table.

html.question: What is the purpose of the <em> tag?
html.hint: This semantic tag emphasizes text, often displayed as italic.

html.question: Which tag creates a button?
html.hint: This tag creates a clickable element, often in forms.

html.question: What does the <div> tag do?
html.hint: This non-semantic tag is a container for other elements.

html.question: Which tag defines a heading?
html.hint: This tag is one of six levels for titles, starting with the largest.

html.question: Which attribute sets an elementâ€™s unique identifier?
html.hint: This attribute ensures an element can be uniquely targeted by CSS or JS.

html.question: What does the <link> tag do?
html.hint: This tag is often used to connect CSS files to HTML.

html.question: Which tag is used for inline frames?
html.hint: This tag embeds external content like maps or videos.

html.question: What does the <caption> tag define?
html.hint: This tag provides a title or description for a table.

html.question: Which attribute specifies a form input type?
html.hint: This attribute defines the kind of input, like text or checkbox.

html.question: What is the purpose of the <mark> tag?
html.hint: This tag visually emphasizes text, often with a background color.

html.question: Which tag defines a keyboard input?
html.hint: This tag represents user input, like Ctrl+C, in documentation.

html.question: What does the <abbr> tag represent?
html.hint: This tag is used for acronyms or abbreviations with a 'title' attribute.

html.question: Which attribute sets the default value of an input?
html.hint: This attribute pre-fills an input field with a default.

html.question: What does the <cite> tag indicate?
html.hint: This tag references a source, like a book or article title.

html.question: Which tag defines a progress bar?
html.hint: This tag shows task completion, like a download bar.

html.question: What does the <details> tag do?
html.hint: This tag creates an expandable section, often with <summary>.

html.question: Which attribute specifies a minimum input value?
html.hint: This attribute sets the lowest allowed value for numeric inputs.

html.question: What is the purpose of the <summary> tag?
html.hint: This tag provides a title for a <details> element.

html.question: Which tag defines a dialog box?
html.hint: This tag creates a pop-up or modal with JavaScript support.

html.question: What does the <data> tag provide?
html.hint: This tag pairs content with a 'value' attribute for scripts.

html.question: Which attribute specifies an imageâ€™s width?
html.hint: This attribute sets the horizontal size of an image in pixels.

html.question: What does the <output> tag represent?
html.hint: This tag displays computed results within a form.

html.question: Which tag defines a ruby annotation?
html.hint: This tag is used for East Asian text annotations.

html.question: What does the <template> tag do?
html.hint: This tag stores content for JavaScript to clone later.

html.question: Which attribute makes a field read-only?
html.hint: This attribute prevents editing but allows interaction.

html.question: What is the purpose of the <base> tag?
html.hint: This tag sets a default URL for relative links.

html.question: Which tag defines a table data cell?
html.hint: This tag holds content within a table row.

html.question: What does the <strong> tag indicate?
html.hint: This semantic tag emphasizes text, often displayed as bold.

html.question: Which tag embeds an external resource?
html.hint: These tags can embed content like multimedia or external pages.

html.question: What does the <bdi> tag do?
html.hint: This tag handles text direction for languages like Arabic.

html.question: Which attribute sets a formâ€™s submission method?
html.hint: This attribute chooses between GET or POST for form submission.

html.question: What is the purpose of the <optgroup> tag?
html.hint: This tag organizes <option> tags in a <select> menu.

html.question: Which tag defines a superscript?
html.hint: This tag raises text, like for exponents in math.

html.question: What does the <sub> tag define?
html.hint: This tag lowers text, like for chemical formulas.

html.question: Which attribute specifies a formâ€™s target frame?
html.hint: This attribute defines where a formâ€™s response is displayed.

html.question: What does the <meter> tag represent?
html.hint: This tag shows a value within a defined range, like a gauge.

html.question: Which tag defines a text track for media?
html.hint: This tag adds subtitles or captions to <video> or <audio>.

html.question: What is the purpose of the <var> tag?
html.hint: This tag denotes a variable in math or programming contexts.

html.question: Which attribute sets an elementâ€™s language?
html.hint: This attribute specifies the language code, like 'en' for English.

html.question: What does the <del> tag indicate?
html.hint: This tag shows text that has been removed, often struck through.

html.question: Which tag defines inserted text?
html.hint: This tag shows text added to a document, often underlined.

html.question: What is the purpose of the <samp> tag?
html.hint: This tag displays example output from a program.

html.question: Which attribute specifies a formâ€™s autocomplete?
html.hint: This attribute controls whether browsers suggest form input values.

html.question: What does the <address> tag define?
html.hint: This tag provides contact details, like email or phone.

html.question: Which tag defines a blockquote?
html.hint: These tags format quoted text, one for blocks, one inline.

html.question: What does the <pre> tag do?
html.hint: This tag keeps spaces and line breaks in text.

html.question: Which attribute specifies an imageâ€™s height?
html.hint: This attribute sets the vertical size of an image in pixels.

html.question: What does the <small> tag indicate?
html.hint: This tag reduces text size for fine print or asides.

html.question: Which tag defines a definition list?
html.hint: This tag pairs terms with their descriptions.

html.question: What does the <dt> tag define?
html.hint: This tag specifies a term in a <dl> list.

html.question: Which tag defines a description in a definition list?
html.hint: This tag provides the explanation for a <dt> term.

html.question: What does the <code> tag represent?
html.hint: This tag displays programming code in a monospaced font.

html.question: Which attribute specifies a buttonâ€™s type?
html.hint: This attribute defines a buttonâ€™s role, like 'submit' or 'reset'.

html.question: What does the <area> tag define?
html.hint: This tag creates clickable regions in an image map.

html.question: Which tag defines a client-side script?
html.hint: This tag runs JavaScript code in an HTML document.

html.question: What does the <canvas> tag do?
html.hint: This tag is used with JavaScript for dynamic graphics.

html.question: Which attribute sets a formâ€™s encoding type?
html.hint: This attribute specifies how form data is encoded for submission.

python.question: What is the output of print(2 ** 3)?
python.hint: The ** operator raises the first number to the power of the second.

python.question: What keyword is used to define a function?
python.hint: This keyword is followed by a function name and parentheses.

python.question: Which of these is a list?
python.hint: Lists use square brackets to hold elements.

python.question: What is the result of 10 // 3?
python.hint: The // operator performs floor division, discarding decimals.

python.question: Which module is used for regular expressions?
python.hint: This module handles pattern matching for strings.

python.question: What is the output of print(5 + 3)?
python.hint: The + operator adds numbers in Python.

python.question: Which keyword creates a loop?
python.hint: This keyword iterates over a sequence like a list or range.

python.question: What is the type of '3.14'?
python.hint: Quotes around a number make it a string.

python.question: Which symbol denotes a comment?
python.hint: This symbol starts a single-line comment in Python.

python.question: What is used to indent code blocks?
python.hint: Python typically uses four of these for indentation.

python.question: Which keyword checks conditions?
python.hint: This keyword evaluates a condition for branching.

python.question: What is the output of print(len('hello'))?
python.hint: The len() function counts characters in a string.

python.question: Which type is mutable?
python.hint: This type allows elements to be changed after creation.

python.question: What does 'True' represent?
python.hint: This value is used in logical operations.

python.question: Which operator checks equality?
python.hint: This operator compares two values for equality.

python.question: What is the output of print(10 % 3)?
python.hint: The % operator returns the remainder of division.

python.question: Which keyword exits a loop?
python.hint: This keyword stops a loop entirely.

python.question: What does 'range(5)' generate?
python.hint: This function generates numbers starting from 0 up to but not including 5.

python.question: Which method converts a string to uppercase?
python.hint: This string method changes all characters to uppercase.

python.question: What is the output of print([1,2,3][1])?
python.hint: List indexing starts at 0, so [1] accesses the second element.

python.question: Which keyword defines a class?
python.hint: This keyword creates a blueprint for objects.

python.question: What does 'None' represent?
python.hint: This value indicates the absence of a value.

python.question: Which method adds an element to a list?
python.hint: This method adds an item to the end of a list.

python.question: What is the output of print('a' in 'cat')?
python.hint: The 'in' operator checks if a character exists in a string.

python.question: Which module handles math operations?
python.hint: This module provides functions like sqrt() and pi.

python.question: What does the 'try' keyword do?
python.hint: This keyword is paired with 'except' for error handling.

python.question: What is the output of print(list(range(2,5)))?
python.hint: range(2,5) generates numbers from 2 up to but not including 5.

python.question: Which method removes an element from a list?
python.hint: One method removes by value, the other by index.

python.question: What does the 'lambda' keyword create?
python.hint: This keyword defines a short, nameless function.

python.question: Which module handles file operations?
python.hint: This module provides functions like open() and remove().

python.question: What is the output of print({1: 'one', 2: 'two'}[1])?
python.hint: Dictionary access uses keys to retrieve values.

python.question: Which keyword raises an exception?
python.hint: This keyword triggers a custom error.

python.question: What does 'is' operator check?
python.hint: This operator checks if two objects are the same in memory.

python.question: Which method splits a string?
python.hint: This method breaks a string into a list based on a delimiter.

python.question: What is the output of print(tuple([1,2,3]))?
python.hint: The tuple() function converts a list to an immutable sequence.

python.question: Which keyword imports a module?
python.hint: This keyword brings external modules into a script.

python.question: What is the output of print(3 * 'a')?
python.hint: The * operator repeats a string a given number of times.

python.question: Which type is immutable?
python.hint: This type cannot be modified after creation.

python.question: What does the 'else' keyword do?
python.hint: This keyword follows an 'if' for alternative logic.

python.question: Which operator performs division?
python.hint: This operator divides numbers, returning a float.

python.question: What is the output of print(bool(0))?
python.hint: Zero is considered false in a boolean context.

python.question: Which keyword skips an iteration?
python.hint: This keyword moves to the next loop iteration.

python.question: What does the 'in' operator check?
python.hint: This operator checks if an item exists in a sequence.

python.question: Which method joins a list of strings?
python.hint: This string method combines list elements with a separator.

python.question: What is the output of print(2 + 3 * 4)?
python.hint: Operator precedence multiplies before adding.

python.question: Which module handles random numbers?
python.hint: This module provides functions like randint() and shuffle().

python.question: What does the 'global' keyword do?
python.hint: This keyword allows modifying variables outside a functionâ€™s scope.

python.question: Which method reverses a list?
python.hint: This method changes a listâ€™s order in place.

python.question: What is the output of print('hello'[0])?
python.hint: String indexing starts at 0 for the first character.

python.question: Which keyword defines a constant?
python.hint: Python uses naming conventions like ALL_CAPS for constants.

python.question: What does the 'set' type store?
python.hint: This type automatically removes duplicate entries.

python.question: Which method checks if a string starts with a substring?
python.hint: This method checks the beginning of a string for a match.

python.question: What is the output of print({1,2,2,3})?
python.hint: Sets only store unique values, removing duplicates.

python.question: Which module handles date and time?
python.hint: These modules handle timestamps and date formatting.

python.question: What does the 'yield' keyword do?
python.hint: This keyword produces values one at a time in a function.

python.question: Which method sorts a list?
python.hint: This method reorders a list in place.

python.question: What is the output of print(len({1: 'a', 2: 'b'}))?
python.hint: The len() function counts key-value pairs in a dictionary.

python.question: Which keyword handles multiple exceptions?
python.hint: This keyword catches specific errors after a 'try' block.

python.question: What does the 'map' function do?
python.hint: This function transforms each element in an iterable.

python.question: Which method removes duplicates from a list?
python.hint: Converting a list to this type removes duplicates.

python.question: What is the output of print('a' + 'b')?
python.hint: The + operator concatenates strings in Python.

python.question: Which keyword defines a loop that runs indefinitely?
python.hint: This keyword creates a loop based on a condition.

python.question: What is the type of [1,2,3]?
python.hint: This type uses square brackets and is mutable.

python.question: Which operator performs exponentiation?
python.hint: This operator raises a number to a power.

python.question: What does the 'pass' keyword do?
python.hint: This keyword is used as a no-op in code blocks.

python.question: What is the output of print(4 < 5)?
python.hint: Comparison operators return a boolean value.

python.question: Which method converts a string to lowercase?
python.hint: This string method changes all characters to lowercase.

python.question: What does the 'not' operator do?
python.hint: This operator inverts a boolean value.

python.question: Which method checks if a string is numeric?
python.hint: These methods check if a string contains only digits.

python.question: What is the output of print([1,2] + [3,4])?
python.hint: The + operator concatenates two lists.

python.question: Which module handles JSON data?
python.hint: This module provides functions like dumps() and loads().

python.question: What does the 'filter' function do?
python.hint: This function selects items based on a condition.

python.question: Which method gets a dictionaryâ€™s keys?
python.hint: This method returns a view of dictionary keys.

python.question: What is the output of print(ord('A'))?
python.hint: The ord() function returns the ASCII value of a character.

python.question: Which keyword defines a method in a class?
python.hint: This keyword is used for both functions and class methods.

python.question: What does the 'zip' function do?
python.hint: This function combines elements from multiple iterables.

python.question: Which method checks if a string ends with a substring?
python.hint: This method checks the end of a string for a match.

python.question: What is the output of '123'.toString()?
python.hint: This method ensures a value is a string.

python.question: Which keyword defines an arrow function?
python.hint: This syntax creates a concise function expression.

python.question: What does the 'spread' operator do?
python.hint: This operator (...) unpacks iterables.

javascript.question: Which keyword declares a variable?
javascript.hint: These keywords are used for variable declaration in JavaScript, each with different scoping rules.

javascript.question: What is the output of console.log(typeof [])?
javascript.hint: In JavaScript, arrays are a type of object.

javascript.question: Which method adds an element to the end of an array?
javascript.hint: This method modifies the array in place and returns the new length.

javascript.question: What is the correct way to write an IF statement?
javascript.hint: Conditions in JavaScript if statements are enclosed in parentheses.

javascript.question: Which operator checks for both value and type equality?
javascript.hint: This is known as the strict equality operator.

javascript.question: What does NaN stand for?
javascript.hint: It indicates an invalid or unrepresentable numerical value.

javascript.question: Which function converts a string to an integer?
javascript.hint: This global function parses a string argument and returns an integer.

javascript.question: Which method removes the last element from an array?
javascript.hint: This method modifies the array in place and returns the removed element.

javascript.question: What is the output of typeof null?
javascript.hint: This is a well-known quirk in JavaScript's type system.

javascript.question: Which statement creates a loop that executes a block of code while a condition is true?
javascript.hint: This loop continues as long as its condition remains true.

javascript.question: Which method executes a function once for each array element?
javascript.hint: This method is often used for iterating over arrays without creating a new one.

javascript.question: How do you comment out a single line in JavaScript?
javascript.hint: This is the same as in C++ or Java for single-line comments.

javascript.question: Which method combines two or more arrays?
javascript.hint: This method returns a new array without modifying the existing ones.

javascript.question: What is the purpose of the 'return' statement?
options: Exits a function and returns a value
javascript.answer: Exits a function and returns a value
javascript.hint: It specifies the value that a function sends back to where it was called.

javascript.question: Which event occurs when the user clicks on an HTML element?
javascript.hint: This is one of the most common event handlers for user interaction.

javascript.question: What is the output of console.log(5 + '5')?
javascript.hint: The '+' operator performs string concatenation if one operand is a string.

javascript.question: Which method searches a string for a specified value and returns the position of the match?
javascript.hint: This method returns -1 if the value is not found.

javascript.question: What is the output of console.log(Boolean(''))?
javascript.hint: An empty string is considered a 'falsy' value.

javascript.question: Which operator assigns a value to a variable?
javascript.hint: This is the single equal sign.

javascript.question: What is the output of console.log(typeof undefined)?
javascript.hint: It signifies that a variable has been declared but has not yet been assigned a value.

javascript.question: Which method calls a function or evaluates an expression at specified intervals?
javascript.hint: This function is useful for animations or recurring tasks.

javascript.question: Which keyword is used to handle errors in a try block?
javascript.hint: This block is executed if an error occurs in the preceding try block.

javascript.question: What is the output of console.log(Math.max(10, 20))?
javascript.hint: This method returns the largest of zero or more numbers.

javascript.question: Which method removes the first element from an array?
javascript.hint: This method changes the length of the array and returns the removed element.

javascript.question: What is the output of console.log(+'100')
javascript.hint: The unary plus operator can be used to convert a string to a number.

javascript.question: Which method returns a new array containing the results of calling a provided function on every element in the calling array?
javascript.hint: This method is commonly used for transformations of array elements.

javascript.question: What does JSON.parse() do?
options: Converts a JavaScript object to a JSON string
Parses a JSON string, constructing the JavaScript value or object described by the string
Converts a JSON string to an XML document
javascript.answer: Parses a JSON string, constructing the JavaScript value or object described by the string
javascript.hint: It is used for deserializing JSON data.

javascript.question: Which method sends data to a web server?
javascript.hint: This API provides an interface for fetching resources (including across the network).

javascript.question: What is the output of console.log(10 == '10')?
javascript.hint: The '==' operator performs type coercion before comparison.

javascript.question: Which method selects HTML elements by their ID?
javascript.hint: This method is the most efficient way to access a single element by its unique ID.

javascript.question: What is the output of console.log(Math.floor(7.8))?
javascript.hint: This method rounds a number downwards to the nearest integer.

javascript.question: Which method adds one or more elements to the beginning of an array?
javascript.hint: This method changes the length of the array and returns the new length.

javascript.question: What does JSON.stringify() do?
options: Converts a JavaScript value to a JSON string
Converts a JSON string to an XML document
javascript.answer: Converts a JavaScript value to a JSON string
javascript.hint: It is used for serializing JavaScript objects into JSON.

javascript.question: Which method is used to sort the elements of an array?
javascript.hint: This method sorts the elements in place and returns the sorted array.

javascript.question: What is the output of console.log(null == undefined)?
javascript.hint: Both represent an absence of value and are loosely equal.

javascript.question: Which method is used to remove elements from an array and/or add new elements in their place?
javascript.hint: This method can be used for insertion, deletion, and replacement of elements.

javascript.question: What is the output of console.log(typeof function(){})?
javascript.hint: Functions are a special type that can be checked directly with typeof.

javascript.question: Which method is used to extract a part of a string?
javascript.hint: These methods all serve similar purposes for string extraction with slight differences in parameters.

javascript.question: What is the output of console.log(0 == false)?
javascript.hint: Zero is considered a 'falsy' value in JavaScript.

javascript.question: Which method filters array elements based on a provided function?
javascript.hint: This method creates a new array with all elements that pass the test implemented by the provided function.

javascript.question: What is the output of console.log(parseInt('10.5'))?
javascript.hint: parseInt() parses only the integer part of a number.

javascript.question: Which property returns the length of a string?
javascript.hint: This property is commonly used to determine the number of characters in a string.

javascript.question: What is the output of console.log([1, 2, 3].length)?
javascript.hint: The length property of an array returns the number of elements.

javascript.question: Which statement is used to perform different actions based on different conditions?
javascript.hint: This statement is often used as an alternative to a long chain of if...else if statements.

javascript.question: What is the output of console.log(5 != '5')?
javascript.hint: The '!=' operator performs type coercion, so the values are considered equal.

javascript.question: Which method converts all characters in a string to uppercase?
javascript.hint: This string method returns a new string.

javascript.question: What is the output of console.log('hello'.charAt(0))?
javascript.hint: This method returns the character at the specified index in a string.

javascript.question: Which property returns the number of arguments passed to a function?
javascript.hint: The 'arguments' object is an Array-like object accessible inside functions.

javascript.question: What is the output of console.log(!!'hello')?
javascript.hint: The double NOT operator (!!) is a common way to explicitly convert a value to a boolean.

javascript.question: Which method converts an array to a string?
javascript.hint: This array method creates a comma-separated string.

javascript.question: What is the output of '123'.toString()?
javascript.hint: This method ensures a value is a string.

javascript.question: Which keyword defines an arrow function?
javascript.hint: This syntax creates a concise function expression.

javascript.question: What does the 'spread' operator do?
javascript.hint: This operator (...) unpacks iterables.
